reviewText: I really like this workout.  Allie makes it fun, and the moves vary in intensity and effort.  I especially like the 30-minute length.  If I have time, I'll add 15-20 on the treadmill or elliptical beforehand; it aids with the warm-up, plus adds a bit more cardio time.  I have a weighted ball (not using the Firm version), so it minimizes the rolling around that other reviewers mentioned.  The downside is the ball-lifting moves at the beginning are more challenging since I am lifting a few extra pounds.  I also keep the remote handy so I can position myself during the transitions.  I've got a dozen or so Firm workouts; I used this one maybe once every ten days or so.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I originally wanted to watch this video first before even trying it, because i didn't want to waste my time if the video didn't look challenging. I mainly wanted the excercise ball. I watched for about 10 min and it seemed quite simple, so I decided to try it anyway. Well after about 5 min into the "warm up" i was sweating bullets and my heart rate was up! I was pleasantly surprised that i was actually getting a good full body workout. The only problem i had was that i wanted to concentrate a little more on the abs, and the excercises they did do for the abs it didn't seem long enough to get a burn. But overall, good dvd!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Wasn't actually what I expected.  Guess I'm in better shape than I thought.  It will be great for someone just beginning to work out with a stability ball.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I liked this DVD but some of the moves made my shoulder not so happy. If you have tennis elbow or bursa issues, be careful. I had to wear my tendon trak strap to do this but that's no big deal.
summary: Fun to do, be careful if you have shoulder issues

reviewText: I thought the point of these exercises using a stability ball was "stability"....not zooming thru at a pace I can't keep up with. Then there is the strain on the knees.  Recommend if you are already in shape.
